title: subworkflow - aws create cloudformation stack
description:
Subworkflow to Create an AWS CloudFormation Stack

This subworkflow provides an easy way to trigger the creation of an aws cloudformation stack

parameters:

cf_stackname: (Required) The name of the CloudFormation stack you want to create.
cfyamls3url: (Required) The URL of the CloudFormation YAML file to run (must be stored in S3 and linked to using the following url syntax: https://s3bucket.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/cf.yaml).
awsregion: (Required) The AWS region in which you want to create the CloudFormation stack.
dynatraceawsconnection: (Required) The connection name of the Dynatrace OIDC connection.

This subworkflow requires the custom SSM Document "Dynwf-CreateCloudFormationStack" to be available in the region specified by the awsregion parameter.
Please refer to the instructions below under "Steps to Import AWS SSM Document/Runbook YAML".

Subworkflow will wait for ssm document execution and will fail if ssm document fails.

Workflow-Steps
***************

The subworkflow sends the command to create a cloudformation stack to the
aws SSM document "Dynwf-CreateCloudFormationStack", then waits until
the SSM document has finished and then checks if the creation was 
successful. If not, it will fail the subworkflow to provide a restart on error
functionality to the Parent workflow

This subworkflow Needs subworkflow "subworkflow - aws wait for systems manager document execution"

Steps to Import AWS SSM Document/Runbook Yaml:
***********************************************
1.) Open the Following link https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/documents/create-document?region=us-east-1#documentType=Automation
    That will take you to the AWS Management Console (you need to be logged in) and open the Runbook builder to create a new Runbook.

2.) If needed change the aws region of the Runbook in the console
3.) In the upper left corner Change the Runbook name into "Dynwf-CreateCloudFormationStack"
4.) Click on the {} Code button next to the runbook name this will take you to the yaml def. of the runbook
5.) Paste the Yaml content below into the code field

# yaml file start
schemaVersion: '0.3'
description: |-
  *Replace this default text with instructions or other information about your runbook.*

  ---
  # What is Markdown?
  Markdown is a lightweight markup language that converts your content with plain text formatting to structurally valid rich text.
  ## You can add headings
  You can add *italics* or make the font **bold**.
  1. Create numbered lists
  * Add bullet points
  >Indent `code samples`

  You can create a [link to another webpage](https://aws.amazon.com).
parameters:
  stackname:
    type: String
  cfyamls3url:
    type: String
mainSteps:
  - name: CreateCloudFormationStack
    action: aws:createStack
    isEnd: true
    inputs:
      StackName: '{{ stackname }}'
      Capabilities:
        - CAPABILITY_NAMED_IAM
      TimeoutInMinutes: 120
      TemplateURL: '{{ cfyamls3url }}'
outputs:
  - CreateCloudFormationStack.StackId
  - CreateCloudFormationStack.StackStatus
  - CreateCloudFormationStack.StackStatusReason
  - CreateCloudFormationStack.OutputPayload
# yaml file end

6.) Click on create runbook
